columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the operating cash flow of the project based on the given data and estimations.

As you can notice, depreciation was added back after solving for the tax since depreciation is considered as a noncash expense which means that there is no exchange in cash flow when talking about depreciation.

Solving for the depreciation of this asset, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\dfrac{\$2,320,000}{3}\\[15 pt]
&=\$773,333.33
\end{aligned}$$

The asset loses $\$773,333.33$ in value each year.

Now that we have the depreciation, we can solve for the project operating cash flow using the formula in Step 2. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Operating cash flow}&=(\$1,735,000 - \$650,000 - \$773,333.33)\\
&\times(1-0.21) + \$773,333.33\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,019,550
\end{aligned}$$

The project operating cash flow is $\$1,019,550$
